thread.title: Djokovic caps successful China swing with Shanghai title
thread.title_full: Djokovic caps successful China swing with Shanghai title

author: JUSTIN BERGMAN
title: Djokovic caps successful China swing with Shanghai title
text:
Andy Wong Djokovic caps successful China swing with Shanghai title 
Novak Djokovic of Serbia holds up his winner's trophy after defeating Jo-Wilfried Tsonga of France in the final match of the Shanghai Masters tennis tournament at Qizhong Forest Sports City Tennis Center in Shanghai, China, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo/Andy Wong) STR Djokovic caps successful China swing with Shanghai title 
Novak Djokovic of Serbia looks back after he hits a return shot against Jo-Wilfried Tsonga of France during their final match of the Shanghai Masters tennis tournament at Qizhong Forest Sports City Tennis Center in Shanghai, China, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo) Andy Wong Djokovic caps successful China swing with Shanghai title 
Novak Djokovic of Serbia celebrates after winning his final match against Jo-Wilfried Tsonga of France in the Shanghai Masters tennis tournament at Qizhong Forest Sports City Tennis Center in Shanghai, China, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo/Andy Wong) Andy Wong Djokovic caps successful China swing with Shanghai title 
Jo-Wilfried Tsonga of France stretches his neck while he plays against Novak Djokovic of Serbia during their final match of the Shanghai Masters tennis tournament at Qizhong Forest Sports City Tennis Center in Shanghai, China, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo/Andy Wong) Andy Wong Djokovic caps successful China swing with Shanghai title 
Jo-Wilfried Tsonga of France looks on the ball during his final match against Novak Djokovic of Serbia in the Shanghai Masters tennis tournament at Qizhong Forest Sports City Tennis Center in Shanghai, China, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo/Andy Wong) Andy Wong Djokovic caps successful China swing with Shanghai title 
Novak Djokovic of Serbia, center right, is congratulated by Australian tennis legend Rod Laver, center left, after winning his final match against Jo-Wilfried Tsonga of France in the Shanghai Masters tennis tournament at Qizhong Forest Sports City Tennis Center in Shanghai, China, Sunday, Oct. 18, 2015. (AP Photo/Andy Wong) Posted: Sunday, October 18, 2015 7:53 am | Updated: 11:01 am, Sun Oct 18, 2015. 
SHANGHAI (AP) — Novak Djokovic wore a red shirt in his matches at the Shanghai Masters this week to connect with his Chinese fans and perhaps give himself a little boost. 
"I know it's a lucky national color, so it's my lucky charm," he said. Subscription Required An online service is needed to view this article in its entirety.   Need an account? Create one now.
